SEARCH
Package bn.inference

Class RejectionSamplingInferencer

java.lang.Object
bn.inference.RejectionSamplingInferencer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Inferencer
public class RejectionSamplingInferencer extends Object implements Inferencer
Implements the rejection sampling algorithm for approximate inference in Bayesian networks described in AIMA Figure 14.14.

    query(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork network, int n)
    Return an estimate of the Distribution P(X|e) from the given BayesianNetwork, where X is the query RandomVariable, e is an ArrayMapAssignment representing the evidence variables and their values, and n is the total number of samples to be generated.

    • query

      public Distribution query(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork network, int n)
      Return an estimate of the Distribution P(X|e) from the given BayesianNetwork, where X is the query RandomVariable, e is an ArrayMapAssignment representing the evidence variables and their values, and n is the total number of samples to be generated.

    • isConsistent

      protected boolean isConsistent(Assignment x, Assignment e)
      Returns true if ArrayMapAssignment x is consistent with ArrayMapAssignment e, in the sense that every variable in e has the same value in x.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] argv) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXException, IOException, NumberFormatException
      Test RejectionSamplingInferencer.

      Usage: 

           java bn.inference.RejectionSamplingInferencer N FILE QVAR [EVAR EVAL]*
      The arguments are as follows: first, the number of samples to use; second, the XMLBIF file defining the Bayesian Network; third the name of the query variable; and following that the evidence variables and their values (assumed to be Strings) in pairs.

      The example from AIMA 14.4.1 would be run as: 

                     java -cp bin bn.inference.RejectionSamplingInferencer 100000 src/bn/examples/aima-alarm.xml B J true M true
      True distribution is approx. <0.284,0.716>.

      The example from AIMA 14.5.1 (Figure 14.12a) would be run as: 

                     java -cp bin bn.inference.RejectionSamplingInferencer 100000 src/bn/examples/aima-wet-grass.xml R S true
      True distribution is <0.3,0.7>.
      Throws:
      ParserConfigurationException
      SAXException
      IOException
      NumberFormatException
